node.title: Jacqueline Avant, Philanthropist and Wife of Music Producer Clarence Avant, Is Fatally Shot
node.alt: Jacqueline Avant with her husband, the music executive Clarence Avant, in 2019. Mrs. Avant was fatally shot at her home in Beverly Hills early Wednesday.
node.description: Ms. Avant, 81, was found with a gunshot wound after the police received a report of a shooting at her home in Beverly Hills early Wednesday, the police said.
node.content: ["Jacqueline Avant, a philanthropist and the wife of Clarence Avant, an influential music producer and executive, was fatally shot at the couple\u2019s home in Beverly Hills, Calif., on Wednesday morning, according to the police.", "Ms. Avant, 81, was found with a gunshot wound after the police received a report of a shooting at the home at 2:23 a.m., Chief Mark Stainbrook of the Beverly Hills Police Department said at a news conference on Wednesday afternoon.", "The suspect or suspects were no longer on the scene when the police arrived, Chief Stainbrook said.", "Chief Stainbrook said that the police would not speculate on whether Ms. Avant had been shot during an attempted robbery, and he declined to describe the shooting as part of a home invasion. He urged anyone with information about the crime to contact the police.", "\u201cObviously, someone went into the home,\u201d Chief Stainbrook said. \u201cWe just don\u2019t know what the purpose was or what the motive was behind it.\u201d", "Chief Stainbrook said that a security guard was at the home during the shooting, but would not comment on whether Mr. Avant was there. \u201cI don\u2019t think it\u2019s a random attack, but I can\u2019t speculate on that right now,\u201d he said.", "A former model active in the arts and philanthropy, Ms. Avant was married for more than 50 years to Mr. Avant, a highly regarded music producer who advised Presidents Bill Clinton and Barack Obama and was known as \u201cthe Godfather of Black Music.\u201d", "In the 1960s, Ms. Avant was a model for Ebony Fashion Fair, a traveling fashion show that hired Black models wearing clothes made by Black designers.", "It was around that time that she began dating Mr. Avant, who kept trying to impress her by showing off how much money he had made, according to the Netflix documentary \u201cThe Black Godfather,\u201d which was about Mr. Avant.", "\u201cHe\u2019d always have a car pick me up and I thought: \u2018Who is this guy?\u2019\u201d Ms. Avant said. \u201cOne day, I guess, he was really trying to win me over and, for some reason, he mentioned how much he had paid the Internal Revenue Service.\u201d", "In the documentary, actors and producers who knew the couple marveled at the longevity of the couple\u2019s marriage and their fierce loyalty to each other.", "\u201cThey look so amazing,\u201d the actor Jamie Foxx said. \u201cThey still look like they\u2019ve got wedding cake on their feet, like they just walked off a soul wedding cake.\u201d", "Chief Stainbrook described the shooting as a \u201cdifficult day for our city\u201d and said that the Avant family\u2019s \u201ccontributions to the world of entertainment and to better communities across Los Angeles are unmatched.\u201d", "Reading a statement from the family, he said: \u201cJacqueline was an amazing woman, wife, mother, philanthropist and a 55-year resident of Beverly Hills who has made an immeasurable positive contribution and impact on the arts community. She will be missed by her family, friends and all of the people she has helped throughout her amazing life.\u201d", "Mr. Avant started Sussex Records in 1969 and signed Bill Withers, releasing some of his best-known songs, including \u201cAin\u2019t No Sunshine,\u201d \u201cUse Me\u201d and \u201cLean on Me.\u201d In 1971, he started Avant Garde Broadcasting, one of the first Black-owned radio stations in the country, according to the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame. Mr. Avant was inducted into the hall in May.", "Over the years, Mr. Avant also worked with Jimmy Jam, Terry Lewis and Babyface. He helped promote Michael Jackson\u2019s \u201cBad\u201d world tour in 1987, and was chairman of the board of Motown Records, according to the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame.", "The couple\u2019s daughter, Nicole A. Avant, was a producer of \u201cThe Black Godfather,\u201d which featured testimonials from Mr. Obama and Mr. Clinton, as well Vice President Kamala Harris, who was then a presidential candidate. Nicole Avant is married to Ted Sarandos, a co-chief executive of Netflix, and is a former U.S. ambassador to the Bahamas.", "On Wednesday, Mr. Clinton paid tribute to Ms. Avant.", "\u201cJackie Avant was a wonderful woman, a great partner to Clarence and mother to Alex and Nicole, an active citizen & a dear friend to Hillary and me for 30 years,\u201d Mr. Clinton wrote on Twitter. \u201cShe inspired admiration, respect & affection in everyone who knew her. We are heartbroken. She will be deeply missed.\u201d"]
